topic.body: Seriously. Haven't checked anything on the technical side yet, but at least you made it look super-good. Kudos for that.

topic.title: Restrict posting by ID?
topic.body:
Is it possible, on a given site (which I'm the owner) to restrict edition to only a selected set of ZeroIDs?

I guess it should be possible to only show posts from those IDs, but I'd rather have contents from unseen users not stored at all, right?

1_1NyGo7eBax4F1dm1gsoVHg9gCqm5EUhFAP.body:
The dashboard is nothing if there's no underlying code to actually make the changes. For now, it's relatively easy to tweak things by hand. I guess the easiest path, for now, would be to publish several "template" blogs, ready to be cloned, with different themes/appearances. People would then be able to choose which one they like the most and clone from there.

For advanced settings, it probably will always mean a little CSS editing (maybe LESS/SASS could help here, but still). Doesn't mean a text field to edit said CSS/LESS/SASS wouldn't be a welcome addition ;)

There. I'm not a designer nor an artist, but this should be a clone-able blog with a slightly different theme : http://127.0.0.1:43110/1LndwkWLnXfd1cbCReWguGVNhiboP9iqPD

Took about three minutes, publishing included. Though I do admit I prefer the original colours, myself ;)

2_1J2AKukZAJ5b6dJgBjMgWCBUGw7ZVh46XH.body: Even more interesting : would it be possible to restrict parts of a ZeroSite to non-authorized ZeroIDs? And not just by "not showing them"?
